nodes.bodyText: The entire AbstractMultiQuickfixTest class is marked with the @since 2.23 , so there is no need to add the since tag to the method.

nodes.bodyText: wonder why there need to be two initalText params
but how is the marker information extracted from then? isnt it sufficient to have the second parameter only?
If you have only the second parameter, than the additional marker information has to be removed from it to get the initial DSL text. That is really difficult in case of complex dsls, I think.
i still dont like this. at other places we remove markers too

Is the -------------------------- separator a static constant, or variable? I am getting...
expected:<...--------------------[]
0: message=The oper...> but was:<...--------------------[---------------------------------------]
0: message=The oper...>

...when I attempted to consume this API.
It is dynamically calculated and have the same length as the longest line in the dsl.

Good idea! I was also thinking about providing more overloaded versions of the testMultiQuickfix method.
@cdietrich @szarnekow @kthoms @ArneDeutsch What do you think?
